column4: anyone running breezy, and installed beagle or linux-image-2.6.12 from repositories?
i suspect that beagle needs some deps before it hits the repos
i saw it on the beagle upstream, but i can only find it in the breezy_universe_sources list
it has built, but not in the repos, I don't know why
it has built correctly
it just isn't there yet
I would wait, the mono stuff is being built right now
ah ok, for some reason, lot's of the things i noticed coming in on the breezy-changes list, aren't  reflected in aptitude, ( i'm just a sucker for the new stuff )
that means the source has been accepted
it may not even build
http://people.ubuntu.com/~lamont/buildLogs/byDate/today.html
ok hmm, thanks
there are a lot of major changes happening right now
yeah so a lot of things are getting built but a lot are failing as well
expect breakage and don't bug the dev team about packages not showing up
the date by which you should start asking is around late Sept.

i guess before when i was watching hoary-changes, most of the builds were succesful, so the packages would end up as binaries in an hour or so, but because of the volitale nature of breezy many of these builds won't go through right away
change over to gcc 4.0 is a big one
and the general sync to sid
yeah i know
i just found beagle in the build log, built succesfuly
but it isn't there, I have no idea why
ok, well thanks anyway
i have
